repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The Larkspur Press records (dated 1973-2000; 7.3 cubic feet; 8 boxes) primarily comprise press proofs, broadsides, commercial work, correspondence, and manuscripts created between 1973 and 2003 that document publications of The Larkspur Press, a small letterpress publisher operated by Gray Zeitz that is based in Monterey, Kentucky.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: The Larkspur Press is a small letterpress publisher based in Monterey, Kentucky, established by Gray Zeitz in 1974. Zeitz was born in 1950 in Mobile, Alabama, and was raised in Elizabethtown, Kentucky. He established the Monterey Volunteer Fire Department where he volunteered for twenty-three years, and was the Monterey city clerk for ten years. Zeitz discovered letterpress printing as a student apprentice to Carolyn Hammer at the University of Kentucky King Library Press. The Larkspur Press focuses on the elegant presentation of works written by Kentucky authors. Over the years the press has worked with Guy Davenport, Bobbie Ann Mason, Wendell Barry, and James Baker Hall among many others. Because of his work in printing, publication, and promotion Gray Zeitz is held as a major contributor to the literary arts scene in Kentucky. Carolyn Whitesel, an associate of the press, is responsible for much of the artwork and book binding. Books, broadsides, and other print media produced by the Larkspur Press can be found for sale today in many Kentucky bookstores.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 2021ms055 : [identification of item], Larkspur Press Records, 1971-2000, University of Kentucky Special Libraries Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Larkspur Press records (dated 1973-2000; 7.3 cubic feet; 8 boxes) primarily comprise press proofs, broadsides, commercial work, correspondence, and manuscripts created between 1973 and 2003 that document publications and business of The Larkspur Press, a small letterpress publisher operated by Gray Zeitz that is based in Monterey, Kentucky. Literary project files contain a mix of correspondence, design drawings, proofs, corrected proofs, announcements, and invitations to readings related to literary projects. Files are organized chronologically by project. The series of portfolio binders showcase a variety of small printing projects such as wedding invitations, business cards, envelopes, announcements, and small broadsides. The items have been removed from their three-ring binders and placed in original order in folders. The types of materials and dates often overlap in this series, but original order as they appeared in the binders has been maintained.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The items contained within this series were originally housed in portfolio binders. The items were removed from the binders while maintaining origninal order. The current foldering reflects that order.
